channel.title: Alloy on mostlymaths.net
channel.description: Recent content in Alloy on mostlymaths.net

item.title: Data pipelines with Alloy, Take 2
item.description: In which I write some easy Alloy code for a data model, with change over time.

item.title: Modelling data pipelines with Alloy
item.description: In which I write some easy Alloy code for a data model.

item.title: 2019#31 Readings of the Week
item.description: This week there is a lot of functional programming (mostly Scala, a bit of Haskell) and data engineering topics. Of course, there is also the usual random stuff I find interesting as well (and other engineering topics).

item.title: 2019#30 Readings of the Week
item.description: A mixed bag of interesting history tidbits sprinkled with Haskell code, Scala stuff, data engineering systems and practices, and how to code with your voice.

item.title: 2019#29 Readings of the Week
item.description: This feels like a heavy engineering edition. A lot of Haskell, Rust, Python and Scala. There’s still a bit of everything, but this will appeal hardcore developers more than usual.

item.title: 2019#9 Readings of the week (x4)
item.description: You know how you slip once on a habit and everything goes crazy? Well, I’ve been 4 weeks without writing these, so here’s the accumulated reading from 4 weeks. Because, even if I don’t write it, I read a lot anyway. Also, there’s lot of interesting content this “week”.

item.title: 2019#8 Readings of the week
item.description: This edition has Software engineering, formal methods, fraud, Scala. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well. You can check all my weekly readings by checking the [tag here](https://www.mostlymaths.net/search/label/ReadingsOfTheWeek, Readings) . You can also get these as a weekly newsletter by subscribing here.

item.title: 2019#7 Readings of the week
item.description: Formal methods, Scala, productivity. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well.
